title: Château Vermont 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This is a green, grassy style of wine, with lively acidity, refreshing fruitiness and a mineral edge. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Cupcake 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Plum aromas meet dried oregano, graphite and bell pepper touches on the nose of this bottling. Light strawberry flavors are accented with an iron-tinged character and more bell pepper on the palate.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Brado Red (Alentejano)
description: The Borba cooperative is in one of the most productive Alentejo wine regions. With this simple and fruity wine, it has captured warmth as well as ripe tannins. Berry fruits and acidity give it a lift. Drink now.

title: Château du Claouset 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: With a yeasty aroma, this Vignobles Siozard wine is ripe with hints of yellow fruits as well as a smooth texture. It is soft, with just a final tang of acidity.

title: Château du Cros 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A crisp and taut wine, this is nervy and lively with attractive fruitiness. It is still young, with acidity very much to the fore. Drink from late 2017.

title: Black Ink 2015 Rosé (California)
description: This light-bodied wine has a pale pink Provençal color but quite a bit of fruit flavor. It feels soft on the palate and tastes lightly sweet.

title: Domaine Sauvat 2016 Coquines Pinot Noir (Puy de Dôme)
description: This is a young tannic wine. It needs time to show up the red fruits that are underneath the dryness. There is potential for a fine juicy softly textured future. Drink from 2018.

title: Jack 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: The white from baseball players Chris Iannetta and Vernon Wells includes 12% Sauvignon Musqué and was aged six months in oak. The oak shows through in abundance, accenting a lush mouthful of baked pineapple fruit.

title: Finca Albret 2015 Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Flat, earthy raisin and prune aromas in this Garnacha indicate very ripe, almost desiccated fruit. The palate is much like the nose: flat and low on vitality. Jammy blueberry and herbal flavors finish chunky, without lift or nuance.

title: Finca Patagonia 2015 Expedicion Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)
description: Generic berry, cherry and plum aromas are saucy and earthy. This everyday Cabernet feels rubbery and grabby. Slightly stewed berry, spice and herbal flavors finish bumpy, with hard tannins.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)
description: This everyday wine feels chunky due to low acidity. Its dusty aromas are generic and not very fruity or expressive, and its meandering cherry and plum flavors precede a simple finish.

title: Maison Bouey 2016 Collection Baruaud Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This is a crisp wine, almost tart. It needs to soften to allow the red-currant fruitiness to shine. It will be attractive after late summer 2017.

title: Maison Bouey 2016 Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This fruity, crisp wine offers layers of acidity and bright fruit, with a refreshing burst of red currants. It's delicious and ready to drink now.
designation: Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche

title: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2015 Fatum Red (La Mancha)
description: Reedy, slightly green red berry aromas come with oaky milk chocolate notes in this blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Bobal. Its woody, lean flavors are shy on fruit, tasting mostly of oak on the scratchy finish.

title: Ribbon Cliff 2014 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is lighter in color, with aromas of sawdust, cherry and barnyard. The style is quite faint, with spice flavors on the finish.

title: Viña Maipo 2016 Vitral Reserva Chardonnay (Chile)
description: A blend of simple stone-fruit and citrus aromas exhibits a touch of vegetal green. This feels balanced but highly regular, while briny citrus and persimmon flavors hang around on the finish.

title: Viñedos Marchigüe 2016 Marchile Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)
description: Briny pithy citrus aromas and a standard-feeling palate tell you this is regular but solidly made. Citrus flavors are largely ripe, while pithy grapefruit notes are found on the finish. Drink now.

title: Santa Ema 2016 Amplus Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Vegetal-leaning aromas of beans, peas and squash lead to a round somewhat flabby palate. Green, herbal flavors crowd out mild citrus and melon notes in front of a low-acid soft finish.

title: Santos & Santos 2016 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a young fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits and gentle tannins that are surrounded by the comfortable full-bodied texture. It's a wine to drink now.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte

title: Tossals 2015 Junior Red (Montsant)
description: A vibrant purple color and foxy berry aromas announce the jammy palate and punchy acidity of this wine. It tastes of herbal plums and berries and doesn't hold up on the oaky, pulpy finish.

title: Cantina Ariano 2016 Sogno di Volpe Rosato (Puglia)
description: Made with Montepulciano grapes, this has fruity aromas of crushed berry and citrus. Reflecting the nose, the light easygoing palate offers suggestions of sour cherry and tangerine zest alongside bright acidity.

title: Bostavan 2014 Via Etulia Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Moldova)
description: This wine has aromas of cranberry and black raspberry. It offers soft tannins and flavors of cassis, black cherry and cherry vanilla before the fruit-filled finish.

title: Château Recougne 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Lively and crisp, this wine offers a pure line of citrus fruit. Its acidity and herbal edge are right up front, refreshing and aromatic. The wine is ready to drink now.

title: Château Roquefort 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Brightly fruity, this blend with 85% Sauvignon Blanc goes for the tropical-fruit character of the grape. Attractive acidity and a zingy edge are balanced by ripe apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink from late 2017.

title: Château Carignan 2016 Château Léon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This 19th-century chateau is situated on the plateau above the Garonne near Cadillac. A soft wine, it's lightly fruity and with a crisp edge. It offers attractive red-berry fruits and just the right acidity. Drink now.

title: Château Carignan 2016 L'Orangerie de Carignan Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This blend of 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon is lightly herbal, with a touch of attractive tannins. It's ripe but preserves a crisp edge to balance the caramel flavor. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Château d'Haurets 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: While this wine has high acidity, it also offers attractive fruitiness. It is light and bright, with a layer of spice and pepper. Drink the wine now.

title: Château Fonfroide 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Pale in color, this crisp wine offers a touch of yeastiness that contrasts with the red-currant fruits. It has plenty of bright acidity as well as a tangy, zesty aftertaste.

title: Ascevi Luwa 2015 Ceròu Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This opens with subdued aromas that evoke dried yellow flower and overripe citrus peel. The aromas carry over to the lean brisk palate along with suggestions of lemon, bitter yellow-apple skin and an unusual funky hint of crushed black olive.

title: Enoport 2016 Faisão White (Vinho Verde)
description: Named after the pheasant (Faisão), the wine is crisp enough to be refreshing. It is medium sweet and lightly textured with orange zest. Drink now.
